thread.title: North East devolution deal is back on the cards - but only North of the Tyne
thread.title_full: North East devolution deal is back on the cards - but only North of the Tyne

author: Dan O'Donoghue
title: North East devolution deal is back on the cards - but only North of the Tyne
text:
Devolution North East meeting at County Hall in Durham Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A devolution deal for the North East is back on - at least North of the Tyne that is. 
The Chronicle understands that the leaders of Newcastle , Northumberland and North Tyneside have been told by the Secretary of State for Business, Innovation and Skills Sajid Javid that the Government will back a new deal. 
The deal has the potential to bring extra money and powers from Whitehall to the North East and will see the election of a mayor - similar to that in Manchester and Liverpool. 
Four months ago the whole project looked doomed - as disagreements over funding and the uncertainty caused by the Brexit vote led to the deal being voted down by Gateshead, Sunderland and South Tyneside. Read More 'Thanks, but no thanks': How devolution for the North East was ended in 155 words 
However Newcastle leader Nick Forbes, Northumberland leader Grant Davey and North Tyneside leader Norma Redfearn refused to walk away - and began negotiations with ministers. 
It emerged on Thursday that the three authorities were now in a position to hold formal talks with Whitehall and discuss the parameters of a new deal. 
Mr Forbes told the Chronicle: â€œWhen four councils voted against going ahead with a devolution deal for the North East, Newcastle and others in favour of taking powers out of Westminster had a choice to make. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
